Bankside Consistency

Source: vignettes/bankside-consistency.Rmd
bankside-consistency.Rmd

Welcome

This document has been created following the generic assessment guidance.

This is the Rapid Assessment Technique (RAT) for rsults from bankside invertebrates analysis to check consistency with Water Body Status.

Description

Basic details about the assessment. Update the ‘response’ values as required.

question response
name_short Bankside Consistency
name_long Rapid Assessment of Bankside Consistency with Water Body Status
parameter River Family Inverts
status prototype
type metric

Input

A list of questions required to run the assessment.

location_id sample_id date_taken question response label parameter type max min source
206972 12345 2019-11-21 Taxon abundance 12 Baetidae River Family Inverts number NA NA sepa_ecology_results
206972 12345 2019-11-21 Live abundance 21 Baetidae BANKSIDE_INVERTS number NA NA sepa_ecology_results

Assessment

If applicable, write a function to assess your input data and return an outcome. For example, a metric, statistic, prediction etc.

Outcome

The outcome of your assessment.

#> package maintainers should consider adding sf to Suggests:.
#> The sp package is now running under evolution status 2
#>      (status 2 uses the sf package in place of rgdal)
sample_id question response
12345 Reference NTAXA 21.14
12345 Reference ASPT 7.32
12345 assessment Likely problem detected
12345 driver ntaxa
12345 action Urgent discussion required with Ecology

Check

Run checks on the assessment.

#> Test passed 
#> Test passed
check value
standard_names TRUE
standard_required TRUE
standard_required_values TRUE

Update

Update the catalogue of assessments to make them available.

#> ✔ Setting active project to '/home/runner/work/hera/hera'
#> ✔ Saving 'catalogue' to 'data/catalogue.rda'
#> • Document your data (see 'https://r-pkgs.org/data.html')

After updating the catalogue, rebuild the package, click on Build > Install and Restart menu or ‘Install and Restart’ button in the Build pane.
